description.narrative:
1) Increased Access to Finance to the Underserved Population: The proposed project will significantly increase access to finance for large populations at the bottom of the pyramid.
2) Women's Empowerment: The proposed project will help to increase access to finance for women borrowers and will enable them grow their businesses and support their families financially.
3) Job Creation: The Project will directly create employment opportunities within the Bank as well as create broader employment opportunities arising from the creation and expansion of microfinance enterprises that the Bank supports. BTPN currently employs about 13,000 staff and expects to employ more people to support the growth of its business.

PT. Bank Tabungan Pensiunan Nasional Tbk (BTPN or the Bank) is emerging as a regional leader in microfinance in Asia and has been a valued IFC client since 2009. It uses an innovative business model that combines access to finance with access to training to reach micro, small and women entrepreneurs with the objectives of improving their lives and businesses. The Project (BTPN Loan II) builds on this successful and growing relationship and intends, through loans in Indonesian Rupiah, to help BTPN to: (i) expand its micro-banking business to serve mass market and low-income customers; and (ii) strengthen its funding base in order to reduce asset and liability mismatch with a longer tenor financing package.

name.narrative: BTPN is headquartered in Jakarta, Indonesia and has 1, 096 outlets located throughout Indonesia. Over 464 outlets are dedicated to the pension business, over 569 are dedicated to the microfinance business and over 63 are dedicated to funding business. BTPN plans to open several more microfinance outlets nationwide over the next three years.
